DOC.brief_title: Minimal Versus Conventional Exposure Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.detailed_description: Postoperative pain often moderate severe follow unicompartmental knee arthroplasty . In order reduce postoperative pain improve mobilization minimal invasive technique develop . After 8-10 cm skin incision , medial parapatellar capsule incision make . The rectus tendon vastus medialis incise patella evert . In recent year The Local Infiltration Analgesia ( LIA ) technique develop reduce postoperative pain . With LIA-technique , long-acting local anesthetic ( ropivacaine ) , nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( ketorolac ) , epinephrine infiltrate intraoperatively via intraarticular catheter postoperatively . The aim study investigate Minimal Invasive Surgery result less postoperative pain good mobilization conventional technique Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty , provide group receive Local Infiltration Analgesia .
